titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lynn Saville Photographs, 1972-2015 and undated RL.01142

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection dates from 1972 to 2015 and consists of over 200 large color and black-and-white photographic prints of nighttime scenes selected from the work of photographer Lynn Saville in urban centers such as Paris, Rome, Venice, New York City, Durham, North Carolina, Los Angeles, Vermont, and other locations. The collection also includes 30 portraits of artists, feminists, writers, family members, and other individuals, as well as self-portraits. Supplemental materials such as book reviews and book maquettes round out the collection. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lynn Saville is a photographer based in New York City. She was born in Durham, North Carolina in 1950 and received a B.A. from Duke University in 1971 and an M.F.A. from the Pratt Institute in 1976. Her photographs are held in the Denver Art Museum, the Brooklyn Museum of Art, Oxford University's Bodleian Library, the New York Public Library, and many other museums and libraries. In 2017 she was awarded a commission by the New York City MTA Arts to document "Grand Central Revealed," which culminated in a three-year exhbit.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Original audiovisual materials in the Supplemental Materials series are closed to use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Lynn Saville photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2002 and 2005, and 2016, and as a purchase in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lynn Saville Photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Karen Glynn, Paula Jeannet, 2003, 2016.
Encoded by Katherine Castles, Paula Jeannet, 2010, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of selections of work from photographer Lynn Saville's portraiture and night photography from urban America, dating from 1972-2015. Formats include traditional darkroom gelatin silver prints, color prints, and a small number of digital prints. Sizes range from 11x14 to 20x24 inches.

The Portraits series includes 30 images of poets, photographers, family members, friends, and prominent women such as Barbara Jordan, Adrienne Rich and Bella Abzug. The collection's primary focus, however, is Saville's more recent work, housed in the Nocturnal Photography and Dark City series, containing 205 photographs of night scenes in the United States and Europe, particularly New York City (with a focus on Brooklyn) and Paris. Other locations include Los Angeles, North Carolina, Vermont, Paris, Rome, and Venice.
Selected images are also available online as part of a Duke University Libraries digital exhibit.

There is also a Supplemental Materials series which includes printed matter such as articles and book reviews, and a documentary film directed by Anna Borden about Saville's career and photography (2003).
Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thirty 11x14 inch gelatin silver prints portraying poets, photographers, women in politics, family members, and friends. The series includes one platinum print portrait of Saville taken by Lois Conner. Captions are taken from the prints.

Ed Malinowski, artist and friend in Vermont, 1974

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series contains 205 16x20 and 20x24 prints. There are color photographs, gelatin silver, and a few Iris prints (digital prints). Matted prints are located at the end of the series. Approximately 75 prints show scenes from New York City, especially Brooklyn. There are also numerous images shot in Paris. Other locations include Rome, Venice, North Carolina, Vermont, Los Angeles, and New York State. Captions are taken from the prints, with information added in some cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color inkjet prints from the project that culminated in a book, Dark City: Urban America at Night. The 57 prints are accompanied by two color book maquettes (mock-ups) used to sequence the photographs; for the book design, Saville worked with well-known artist, educator, and designer Yolanda Cuomo of New York City.
